ai-ud6.5:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud6.5:1.3_0: Now at that time several ascetics and brahmins who follow various other paths were residing in Sāvatthī.
ai-ud6.5:2.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:2.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are eternal.”
ai-ud6.5:3.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:3.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are not eternal.”
ai-ud6.5:4.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:4.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are not eternal.”
ai-ud6.5:5.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:5.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are neither eternal nor not eternal.”
ai-ud6.5:6.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:6.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by oneself.”
ai-ud6.5:7.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:7.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by oneself.”
ai-ud6.5:8.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:8.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by another. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.”
ai-ud6.5:9.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:9.2_0: “The self and the cosmos arose by chance, not made by oneself or another.”
ai-ud6.5:10.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:10.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are eternal.”
ai-ud6.5:11.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:11.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are eternal.”
ai-ud6.5:12.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:12.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are eternal.”
ai-ud6.5:13.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:13.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are neither eternal nor not eternal.”
ai-ud6.5:14.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:14.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by oneself.”
ai-ud6.5:15.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:15.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by oneself.”
ai-ud6.5:16.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:16.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by another. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.”
ai-ud6.5:17.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:17.2_0: “The self and the cosmos arise by chance, not made by oneself or another.
ai-ud6.5:18.1_0: They were arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words. They think:
ai-ud6.5:18.2_0: “Such is Truth, such is not Truth!
ai-ud6.5:18.3_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’”
ai-ud6.5:19.1_0: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ai-ud6.5:19.2_0: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went up to the Buddha,
ai-ud6.5:19.2_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-ud6.5:20.1_0: “Sir, several ascetics and brahmins who follow various other paths have different views, creepers, and diverse views.
ai-ud6.5:21.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.5:21.2_0: The self and the cosmos are eternal,
ai-ud6.5:21.3_0: They were arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words. They think:
ai-ud6.5:21.5_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’”
ai-ud6.5:22.1_0: “The wanderers who follow other paths are blind and sightless.
ai-ud6.5:22.2_0: They don't understand what is beneficial or what is not beneficial, nor what is the truth and what is not the truth.
ai-ud6.5:22.3_0: That’s why they are arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words.
ai-ud6.5:22.5_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’”
ai-ud6.5:23.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
